summary:
## Giant Squid

The giant squid (*Architeuthis dux*) is a huge deep-sea creature. It's one of the largest invertebrates, growing up to 43 feet long, mostly due to its long tentacles.  They are lighter than other giant squids, like the colossal squid. Scientists believe there's only one species. It was first photographed alive in its habitat in 2004 by Japanese researchers.
title: Giant squid
